title: How to Make a Decorated Popsicle Stick Collection (Club)

steps.headline: Firstly, get your Popsicle sticks.
steps.description: They are about $5 per 1,000 sticks at most craft stores if you don't have any. But if you already have some, then get those.

steps.headline: Set up a workstation.
steps.description: Put paper towels down so any substances or glittery messes that would usually get onto your table will now be dry and clean, and the towels can be easily thrown out. Put the towels on a dry surface like a table.

steps.headline: After you set up your station, get out things like paints (not Watercolor), glitter, glitter glue, glue, colored or regular tape, stickers, and any other things that can fit on your Popsicle stick.
Next, to decorate.
steps.description: If you want to create a background, you can paint on the Popsicle sticks. Wait for them to dry, and you can put anything you like on to make a background.

steps.headline: If you want to add glitter to a "backgrounded" or plain stick, put a thin line of glue across the stick, then if you are afraid to get glue on your hands, I advise you not do this, because you have to spread the glue across with your fingers.
steps.description: Then, pour the desired amount of glitter into your left hand if you're right-handed, and right if you left handed. With your free hand, pinch some glitter up and drizzle it onto the gluey Popsicle stick. Then, wait for it to dry to put any other desired items.

steps.headline: You can put on anything else on like stickers or tape.

text: Firstly, get your Popsicle sticks. They are about $5 per 1,000 sticks at most craft stores if you don't have any. But if you already have some, then get those. Set up a workstation. Put paper towels down so any substances or glittery messes that would usually get onto your table will now be dry and clean, and the towels can be easily thrown out. Put the towels on a dry surface like a table. After you set up your station, get out things like paints (not Watercolor), glitter, glitter glue, glue, colored or regular tape, stickers, and any other things that can fit on your Popsicle stick.  Next, to decorate. If you want to create a background, you can paint on the Popsicle sticks. Wait for them to dry, and you can put anything you like on to make a background. If you want to add glitter to a "backgrounded" or plain stick, put a thin line of glue across the stick, then if you are afraid to get glue on your hands, I advise you not do this, because you have to spread the glue across with your fingers. Then, pour the desired amount of glitter into your left hand if you're right-handed, and right if you left handed. With your free hand, pinch some glitter up and drizzle it onto the gluey Popsicle stick. Then, wait for it to dry to put any other desired items. You can put on anything else on like stickers or tape.  Finished.
